sections.heading: Before a Tornado
items: Identify a safe room: basement or interior small room on the lowest level.
Prepare an emergency kit and sturdy shoes.
Know local warning systems and alerts; have a NOAA weather radio.
Secure outdoor items that can become projectiles.
Review sheltering plans for home, school, and work.

sections.heading: During a Tornado
items: Go to your safe room immediately; cover your head and neck.
Avoid windows; put as many walls between you and the outside as possible.
If in a mobile home or vehicle, seek a sturdy building or low-lying area.
Do not try to outrun a tornado in a vehicle; seek shelter.
Wear a helmet if available to reduce head injury.

sections.heading: After a Tornado
items: Stay clear of downed power lines and damaged buildings.
Render aid to the injured and call 911 as needed.
Check for gas leaks; do not use open flames.
Listen for official updates; avoid affected areas unless assisting.
